New Records: Anrich Nortje recorded his career-best figures of 4 for 7 with a high-class pace, and Ottneil Baartman made his World Cup debut, taking a wicket on his first ball
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka's lowest ten-over score in T20I, South Africa's efficient chase, Heinrich Klaasen's crucial contributions, Aiden Markram's wicket being a turning point
Post-Match Reflections: The match marked South Africa's first win in the tournament and highlighted the challenging conditions at the new venue
Miscellaneous Highlights: The tricky pitch with inconsistent bounce and big boundaries affected both teams, and the most dots in a Men's T20 World Cup game were recorded
Others: The match was the first at the newly-created Eisenhower Park, and it was the 100th meeting between South Africa and Sri Lanka in T20I
